title: 293-C
statement: C. Cube Problemtime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutYaroslav, Andrey and Roman love playing cubes. Sometimes they get together and play cubes for hours and hours!Today they got together again and they are playing cubes. Yaroslav took unit cubes and composed them into ana×a×acube, Andrey made ab×b×bcube and Roman made ac×c×ccube. After that the game was finished and the guys left. But later, Vitaly entered the room. He saw the cubes and wanted to make a cube as well. But what size should the cube be? Of course it should be a large cube with the side of lengtha+b+c. Besides, Vitaly decided to decompose the cubes built by Yaroslav, Andrey and Roman and compose his own large cube out of them. However, it turned out that the unit cubes he got from destroying the three cubes just weren't enough to make a large cube. We know that Vitaly was short of exactlyncubes. Vitaly got upset, demolished everything and left. As he was leaving, he met Petya and told him that there had been three cubes in the room and that he needed anothernunit cubes to make his own large cube.Petya entered the room and saw the messily scattered cubes. He wanted to make it neat and orderly again. But he only knows that there had been three cubes, made of small unit cubes and that Vitaly needednmore unit cubes to make a large one! Help Petya understand, how many ways of sizesa,b,care there to restore Yaroslav's, Andrey's and Roman's cubes.InputThe single line of the input contains integern(1 ≤n≤ 1014). We know that all numbersa,b,care positive integers.Please, do not use the%lldspecifier to read or write 64-bit integers in С++. It is preferred to use thecin,coutstreams or the%I64dspecifier.OutputIn the single line print the required number of ways. If it turns out that there isn't a single way of suitable sizes ofa,b,c, print 0.ExamplesInput24Output1Input648Output7Input5Output0Input93163582512000Output39090

processed.result:
You are given an integer $n$ (1 ≤ $n$ ≤ 10<sup>14</sup>).  

Three cubes were built using unit cubes.  The sides of the cubes were of lengths $a$, $b$, and $c$ respectively.  

Vitaly wanted to build a larger cube with side length $a + b + c$.  He found that he was short $n$ unit cubes to do this.

Find the number of ways to choose the side lengths $a$, $b$, and $c$ so that this scenario is possible. If no such combination exists, print 0.

You are given a number.  Find the number of ways to divide this number into three positive integers, where the sum of the three integers is equal to the given number plus a specific value. If no such division is possible, output 0.
